benchmark_details.name: INSTRUCT IR (Instruction Following of Information Retrieval Models)
benchmark_details.overview: INSTRUCT IR is designed to evaluate instruction-following ability of retrieval models with diverse user-aligned instructions for each query, reflecting real-world search scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the instruction-following capabilities of information retrieval models and to improve alignment with user instructions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The challenge lies in accurately simulating real user instructions within an automated data generation setting.

data.source: Generated from the MSMARCO dataset using GPT-4 for instruction creation and target adjustment.
data.annotation: Automatically generated and filtered through a multi-stage pipeline.

methodology.calculation: Robustness score is calculated based on the minimum nDCG score of models responding to the same query with different instructions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher nDCG and Robustness scores indicate better instruction-following capabilities of models.
methodology.validation: Human evaluation ensured quality and validity of generated datasets through majority voting among annotators.
